revision.text: {{talkheader}} {{ArticleHistory |action1=GAN |action1date=21:33, 21 September 2010 |action1link=Talk:HMS Tiger (1913)/GA1 |action1result=listed |action1oldid=386129164 |action2=GTC |action2date=03:25, 17 December 2010 |action2link=Wikipedia:Featured topic candidates/Battlecruisers of the Royal Navy/archive1 |action2result=promoted |action2oldid=399911575 |action3=WAR |action3date=21:08, 23 December 2012 (UTC) |action3link=Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Assessment/HMS Tiger (1913) |action3result=approved |action3oldid=528852480 |action4=FAC |action4date=13:48, 13 January 2013 |action4link=Wikipedia:Featured article candidates/HMS Tiger (1913)/archive1 |action4result=promoted |action4oldid=532859129 |action5=FTC |action5date=22:33, 31 October 2013 (UTC) |action5link=Wikipedia:Featured topic candidates/Battlecruisers of the World/archive1 |action5result=promoted |ftname=Battlecruisers of the world |ft2name=Battlecruisers of the Royal Navy |topic=War |currentstatus=FA }} {{WPMILHIST|A-Class=pass|class=FA|British=yes|Maritime=yes|WWI=yes|OMT=1}} {{WikiProject Ships|class=FA}} ==References== [[User talk:Parsecboy]] Thanks for adding "primarily from [[SMS Moltke (1910)|SMS ''Moltke'']], who scored 13 of those 15 hits." to the page on [[HMS Tiger (1913)]]. However what was the source for this? There is a big problem with many of these pages containing unsourced material. This would gradually be fixed if when people made additions they footnoted them giving the source. Author, ''Name of Source'', page number --[[User:Toddy1|Toddy1]] 07:59, 18 August 2007 (UTC) ==First World War, vs World War One== I reverted an edit that changed ''World War One'' into ''First World War''. The reason for this is that there was already a wikilink in the introduction to [[World War I]].--[[User:Toddy1|Toddy1]] ([[User talk:Toddy1|talk]]) 15:29, 24 November 2007 (UTC) ==Talkin' Turkey== I read [http://warships1discussionboards.yuku.com/forum/viewtopic/id/2981 here] Turkey bought some ex-''Tiger'' 13.5s. Can anybody confirm? Worth a mention? (I'd also wonder what price was paid...) [[User:Trekphiler|TREKphiler]] [[User talk:Trekphiler|hit me ♠ ]] 10:44, 4 April 2009 (UTC) :They weren't delivered. See http://navweaps.com/Weapons/WNBR_135-45_mk5.htm [[User:Rcbutcher|Rcbutcher]] ([[User talk:Rcbutcher|talk]]) 11:49, 4 April 2009 (UTC) ==Conan?== I recognize barbette is technically correct. However, "turret" is by far the more common usage, especially in position references. Should it be changed back? Is there a WP-standard usage? [[User:Trekphiler|TREKphiler]] [[User talk:Trekphiler|any time you're ready, Uhura ]] 10:57, 19 August 2010 (UTC) :What are you referring to?--[[User:Sturmvogel 66|Sturmvogel 66]] ([[User talk:Sturmvogel 66|talk]]) 01:10, 20 August 2010 (UTC) == MkV (H) == I'm led to understand that all later 13.5" BB/BC used the (H) version of the gun (1400lb rather than 1250lb shell) - isn't this also the case with Tiger? — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/89.192.207.179|89.192.207.179]] ([[User talk:89.192.207.179|talk]]) 09:00, 27 January 2014 (UTC) == LOC image - quick note == Found [http://www.loc.gov/pictures/item/ggb2005018507/resource/ this] today [[User:The ed17|Ed]] [[User talk:The ed17|[talk]]] [[WP:OMT|[majestic titan]]] 20:52, 22 March 2016 (UTC) == Magic disappearing 'X' turret == The 'Armament' subsection begins "Tiger mounted eight 45-calibre BL 13.5-inch Mk V guns in four twin hydraulically powered turrets, designated 'A', 'B', 'Q' and 'Y' from front to rear." yet there are six references to an 'X' turret or barbette throughout the article. How should this inconsistency be resolved? [[User:1Rabid Monkey|1RM]] ([[User talk:1Rabid Monkey|talk]]) 07:22, 28 September 2016 (UTC) :Good catch; sources disagree on the turret's name, so I've standardized on X.--[[User:Sturmvogel 66|Sturmvogel 66]] ([[User talk:Sturmvogel 66|talk]]) 16:48, 28 September 2016 (UTC)
